100376.text: HTTP/2 connection health check is enabled by default in all Kubernetes clients to fix persistently broken connections (https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/issues/374). If needed, users can tune the feature via the HTTP2_READ_IDLE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS and HTTP2_PING_TIMEOUT_SECONDS environment variables. The feature is disabled if HTTP2_READ_IDLE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS is set to 0.
100376.markdown: HTTP/2 connection health check is enabled by default in all Kubernetes clients to fix persistently broken connections (https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/issues/374). If needed, users can tune the feature via the HTTP2_READ_IDLE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS and HTTP2_PING_TIMEOUT_SECONDS environment variables. The feature is disabled if HTTP2_READ_IDLE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS is set to 0. ([#100376](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100376), [@liggitt](https://github.com/liggitt)) [SIG API Machinery, CLI, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle, Instrumentation and Node]
100376.author: liggitt

100397.text: Reverts breaking change to inline AzureFile volumes in v1.18.15-v1.18.17; referenced secrets are now correctly searched for in the same namespace as the pod as in previous releases.
100397.markdown: Reverts breaking change to inline AzureFile volumes in v1.18.15-v1.18.17; referenced secrets are now correctly searched for in the same namespace as the pod as in previous releases. ([#100397](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100397), [@andyzhangx](https://github.com/andyzhangx)) [SIG Cloud Provider and Storage]
100397.author: andyzhangx

100452.text: Fixed a bug where a high churn of events was causing master instability by reducing the maximum number of objects (events) attached to a single etcd lease.
100452.markdown: Fixed a bug where a high churn of events was causing master instability by reducing the maximum number of objects (events) attached to a single etcd lease. ([#100452](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100452), [@mborsz](https://github.com/mborsz)) [SIG API Machinery and Instrumentation]
100452.author: mborsz

100514.text: Regenerate protobuf code to fix CVE-2021-3121
100514.markdown: Regenerate protobuf code to fix CVE-2021-3121 ([#100514](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100514), [@joelsmith](https://github.com/joelsmith)) [SIG API Machinery, Auth, CLI, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle, Instrumentation and Node]
100514.author: joelsmith

100670.text: Fixes a data race issue in the priority and fairness API server filter
100670.markdown: Fixes a data race issue in the priority and fairness API server filter ([#100670](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100670), [@tkashem](https://github.com/tkashem)) [SIG API Machinery]
100670.author: tkashem

100715.text: Fixes using server-side apply with APIService resources
100715.markdown: Fixes using server-side apply with APIService resources ([#100715](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/100715), [@kevindelgado](https://github.com/kevindelgado)) [SIG API Machinery, Apps, CLI and Testing]
100715.author: kevindelgado

101114.text:
We have added a new Priority & Fairness rule that exempts all probes (/readyz, /healthz, /livez) to prevent 
restarting of "healthy" kube-apiserver instance(s) by kubelet.
101114.markdown:
We have added a new Priority & Fairness rule that exempts all probes (/readyz, /healthz, /livez) to prevent 
  restarting of "healthy" kube-apiserver instance(s) by kubelet. ([#101114](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/101114), [@tkashem](https://github.com/tkashem)) [SIG API Machinery]
101114.author: tkashem

95783.text: Fixed a race condition on API server startup ensuring previously created webhook configurations are effective before the first write request is admitted.
95783.markdown: Fixed a race condition on API server startup ensuring previously created webhook configurations are effective before the first write request is admitted. ([#95783](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/95783), [@roycaihw](https://github.com/roycaihw)) [SIG API Machinery]
95783.author: roycaihw

97973.text: AWS cloudprovider will ignore provisioning load balancers if the annotation service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type is external or nlb-ip
97973.markdown: AWS cloudprovider will ignore provisioning load balancers if the annotation service.beta.kubernetes.io/aws-load-balancer-type is external or nlb-ip ([#97973](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/97973), [@kishorj](https://github.com/kishorj)) [SIG Cloud Provider]
97973.author: kishorj

99795.text: The maximum number of ports allowed in EndpointSlices has been increased from 100 to 20,000
99795.markdown: The maximum number of ports allowed in EndpointSlices has been increased from 100 to 20,000 ([#99795](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/99795), [@robscott](https://github.com/robscott)) [SIG Network]
99795.author: robscott
